intro.description:
This cheat sheet introduces the task lifecycle and shows how to use the task-focused user interface.
You need an existing project for this sheet.

item.title: Open the Task List view
item.description: If the Task List view is not opened, select in the main menu Window > Show View > Other... > Tasks > Task List or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Create and activate a task
item.description:
In the Task List view, click on the right mouse button, then select New > Category. Enter Tutorials for the category's name.
Then right click on the Tutorials category and select New > Task. In the New Task dialog select Local then click on the Finish button. Enter Learn task-focus for the task's title and change the priority to High using the drop down to the left of the summary. Feel free to add some notes as well.
Right click on the new task and select Activate to activate the task.

item.title: Focus on the task
item.description:
In the Package Explorer the task-focus turns on automatically if you activate a task.
You can turn on or off this function if you click on the Focus on Active Task toogle button in the view's toolbar.
You can use this function in the Outline view too. Turn it on in this view as well.

item.title: Open the file
item.description:
Press down the Alt button and click on the left mouse button on the Package Explorer view. Now you can see all of your projects in the view.
Next Alt+click on an arbitrary project and you can see the files wich are in the project.
With this method, select a class from the project.
After the file is opened you can see the class both in the Package Explorer and in the Outline view.

item.title: Add method to focus
item.description:
Select a method within the editor will result in this method appearing in other focused views including the Outline and Package Explorer views.
Next press the Alt button and click on the class in the Outline view.
Now you can see all methods. Methods which aren't in the task context appear in gray color. Select another method from the list. After selecting, all methods that are not part of the the active task's context will no longer be revealed.

item.title: Landmark
item.description:
If an element's interest rank is high enough, it becomes a landmark. Landmarks are showed in bold font.
You can manually promote an element to landmark status by right clicking on the element and selecting Mark as Landmark.

item.title: Remove from focus
item.description: Right click on a method which is in focus and select Remove from Focus. The method will disappear from the view. You can get it back again by Alt+clicking and re-selecting the method.

item.title: Open another file
item.description: Press down the Alt button and click on the project. Select an arbitrary file from the list with Alt+click. After you open the new file you can see it in the focus and all files will disappear which aren't in the focus.

item.title: Quick Context View
item.description: Press down Ctrl+Shift+Alt+RightArrow buttons, then you can see all elements which are in the focus.

item.title: Complete task
item.description:
In the Task List view, click on the right mouse button on the Learn task-focus task and select deactivate.
Click again on the task with the right mouse button and select Mark > Complete.
The task's name will be struck through in the Task List indicating completion.
